section.para: A facility is a credit line available to the borrower and whose basis is either a line letter or a credit agreement. A deal consists of one or more facilities. A deal is structured for a company by a bank or group of banks to meet the company's financial needs.
To use the modules in Lending Services, your company must have arranged a deal with the Issuing Bank.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The guide uses the terms "Drawdown" and "Loan" interchangeably. The term "Outstanding" is also used to represent the current amount borrowed against an existing facility.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Lending Services Landing Page
section.para:
The Lending Services Landing page displays a list of loan transactions, the transactions are displayed in multiple tabs based on the current status of transaction. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.
The following image illustrates the Loan landing page:

listitem.para:
Use this option to initiate a new request for Loan, enter the desired terms of a new loan and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice. This function displays a list of facilities, from which you can select a facility to be the subject of your drawdown request.The facilities are grouped based on the deal that they belong to. Use the Advanced Filter option and select the filter criterion from Deal, Currency and Entity to display the required Facilities.
The loan initiation feature is available only to maker user.

section.para:
The loan listing page segregates transactions based on their current status like draft, awaiting authorization, awaiting response from client or bank and rejected or purged from bank.The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual transaction or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the loan transactions in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Draft tab is available only to maker user.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing loan transactions that are awaiting client approval from a second user within the corporate.
The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing loan transactions that are awaiting bank approval.
Live
Lists all the approved loan records by the bank. Slide the "Multi Selection for Rollover" icon
to select the loans and initiate a rollover request on an existing loan.
As a pre-condition to grouping loans for rollover, the loan transactions must be of same Facility, Pricing Option, Currency and Rollover date. Once a loan transaction is selected for rollover only the relevant transactions that conform are displayed and all the non-conforming transactions are removed from selection list.
Rejected
Lists all the loan records rejected by the bank. The status given to such records is "Not Processed".

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Deal, Facility, Channel Reference, Entity, Currency and Pricing Option. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant loan records. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed loan records:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of loan transactions.
CSV Download: Download the list of loan transactions displayed on the dashboard.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed loan transactions.

section.title: Initiate Rollover
section.para:
This section provides the details on a loan rollover initiation. You can initiate a loan rollover request on the ongoing loans through following two ways:
Use the action icon available for applicable loan transactions - Hover over the list of transactions and click on the
icon to initiate a rollover for the loan transaction.
Multi Selection for Rollover - Slide this icon
to select multiple loan transactions. After selection of transactions click on "Rollover" icon to initiate rollover.
As a pre-condition to grouping loans for rollover, the loan transactions must be of same Facility, Pricing Option, Currency and Rollover date. Once a loan transaction is selected for rollover only the relevant transactions that conform are displayed and all the non-conforming transactions are removed from selection list.

This section displays a single or list of loans for which you are about to initiate a rollover request. You can perform following actions on the displayed transactions:
Click on the greater than arrow icon to view the details of the loan. The following image illustrates the greater than icon to open the card view, the icon is enclosed in the blue box.
Delete a loan transaction if you do not wish to initiate a rollover request for an already selected loan. The following image illustrates the delete icon enclosed in the red box.
The delete option is present only when there are multiple loan transactions.

section.title: Transaction Details
section.para:
This section describes the information presented on clicking any of the following actions against any given transaction:
Details
Return
Approve

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the Loan Details, all the Events associated with the transaction, Interests associated with the transaction, Repayment Schedule linked with the transaction and Additional Information, which shows customer attachments, if any. The information is spread over five tabs, individual tabs are described below:
Loan Details: Displays the details of the loan transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab opens details in read-only mode.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.
In case an action is pending on the corporate user, a Respond button is present against the stated event, that navigates user to screen to perform the respective action.
Interest: Displays the details of interest incurred on the displayed transaction. You can also download the interest schedule in csv format.
Repayment Schedule: Displays the repayment schedule of the loan transaction. You can also download the repayment schedule in csv format.
Additional Information: Lists the 'Customer Attachments' added as part of this transaction.

You can perform following actions on the opened transactions:
Initiate Rollover: You can initiate a rollover request on the transaction, if applicable.
Request Increase: You can initiate a increase request on the transaction, if applicable.
Make Principal Payment: You can initiate a principal payment transaction, if applicable.
Journey: You can view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
